p:
Hazardous alcohol use is highly prevalent among people living with HIV (PWH).
1 In a large multisite clinical cohort of PWH in the United States, 27% reported hazardous alcohol use and 34% reported binge drinking.
2 In low-income and middle-income countries, hazardous alcohol use among PWH is common, with 20% to 46% of PWH reporting hazardous alcohol use.
3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 Alcohol use has been associated with decreased adherence to antiretroviral therapy (ART)
10, 11, 12 and decreased viral suppression.
13 Alcohol use is also associated with elevated sexual and injection risk behaviors that increase the likelihood of HIV transmission.
7, 14, 15, 16 Despite the known adverse health consequences of alcohol use, there is a lack of evidence-based interventions for PWH,
17, 18, 19, 20, 21 and hazardous and heavy alcohol consumption are frequently not addressed in HIV health care settings.
